name: bladderwort
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a plant with yellow flowers that grows in water or wet soil and has small air-filled parts that catch small organisms: The bladderwort is carnivorous, catching tiny invertebrates in the sacs which give it its name. Bladderwort is usually found in quiet, shallow, acidic waters.
More examplesFewer examplesThe marshes were a haven for bladderworts.Bladderworts are unusual plants in many ways, not least in that they lack a root system.You can find bladderworts anywhere where there is fresh water.
